bibl.title: Ng Key Tung vs. Henry M. White. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division.

div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF NG KEY TUNG FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS ) No. 2897 RETURN
Comes now Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, and as a Return of the Petition in the avobe entitled matter, alleges:
I. That he admits the allegation contained in the first paragraph of said Petition.

II. That as to the second paragraph of said Petition, the imprisonment and restraint of the petitioner is legal and according to law and the treaties between the United States and China; that he admits that the petitioner arrived in Seattle on or about the 15th day of July, 1914, and admits all the allegations succeeding this allegation in said second paragraph of the Petition.
III. That he denies the allegations contained in the third and fourth paragraphs of the Petition.
IV. That as to the allegations contained in the fifth paragraph of said Petition, he has not knowledge and information thereof sufficient to form a belief, and therefore denies the same.
AS AN AFFIRMATIVE DEFENSE SAID HENRY M. WHITE ALLEGES:
I. That the petition shows on its face that it should be denied.

II. That the petitioner was given a fair hearing before the proper immigration authorities, and after considering the testimony taken he was denied admission to the United States and ordered deported, and the decision of the officers was affirmed on appeal to the Secretary of Labor; that the testimony and evidence taken on his application for admission is marked "Exhibit A" and is made a part of this Return.

WHEREFORE, the said Henry M. White prays that the Petition be dismissed and that the petitioner be continued in the custody of the immigration authorities to be deported in the manner provided by law.
div1.ab:
Henry M. White
Commissioner of Immigration.
div1.p: THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, NORTHERN DIVISION, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON ) SS.

HENRY M. WHITE, being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says: That he is the Commissioner of Immigration named in the foregoing Return to Writ; that he has read the said Return, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 25th day of November, 1914.
div1.ab:
Ed M Lakin
Deputy Clerk, U. S. Dist. Court, Western Dist. of Washington
div1.p: Received a copy of the within Return this 27 day of Nov 1914
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF NG KEY TUNG FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
